author: Chad W.

review: Easy set up, easy to use, however ... the Prime option is a big disappointment, as all the programming I look at to watch is PAID meaning you have to pay for it and pay and pay and pay. I have not found one free option (other than the first episode of TV show series.) Other customers have mentioned this too and Amazon needs to listen, the "free" stuff should be a separate tab so I can find it, because right now I feel a bit tricked into buying everything. I thought Prime would include much more free TV. I love Netflix, flat fee and I don't have to worry about racking up a big bill on paid items. I understand the premium new movies having a charge like 'pay for view' / on demand' but old '70s films come on. 'Prime' or P is for Pay. The shipping option for heavy shoppers makes sense but the value for Prime movies/TV is just not there. The FIRE has four quad which adds to the quality, very clear images. The small size is wonderful, not some boxy plastic thing like Roku. I have only buffered once so that is positive. Four stars overall. If Prime was better than I would say five. Fire TV is great Prime not so much.
author: Heather Joyce
